meanings.definition: A stroke or blow made with the back of one's hand.
meanings.sent1: He gave the bully a backhands to defend himself.
meanings.sent2: She received a backhands on her cheek during the fight.
meanings.sent3: The backhands from the toddler was more of a playful tap.
meanings.sent4: His backhands felt like a gentle breeze against her skin.
meanings.sent5: The backhands left a faint mark on his palm.

meanings.definition: To hit or strike with the back of one's hand.
meanings.sent1: She backhands the mosquito that landed on her arm.
meanings.sent2: He tends to backhands when he gets frustrated.
meanings.sent3: The chef backhands the dough to flatten it evenly.
meanings.sent4: The teacher backhands the table to get the students' attention.
meanings.sent5: The cat backhands the toy mouse across the room.

meanings.definition: To hit a tennis ball with a backhand stroke.
meanings.sent1: She backhands the tennis ball with precision and power.
meanings.sent2: He practices his backhands every day to improve his game.
meanings.sent3: The robot backhands the tennis ball flawlessly, never missing a shot.
meanings.sent4: Her backhands on the court are as smooth as silk.
meanings.sent5: The sound of her backhands echoes across the tennis court.
